messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] make-up on kids
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/12/2003 4:56:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... There s not an actor on this planet that doesn t wear make-up---male or female! Even the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/12/2003 4:56:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Laramike12@... writes:


> Should I just lump it (the looks and snares and maybe even
> some comments that I'll get taking them into public), and just say "OK" the
>
> next time I'm asked, or; Do I keep doing what I'm doing, since he/they
> really
> aren't putting up a fight anyway about it, and say "how about not, let's
> just
> wait till we get home"? AND is your answer different if it comes to
> him/them
> **really** wanting to do it? AND is your answer different for my son than
> my
> daughter? SORRY so looooong!!!! Thanks, Lara........

There's not an actor on this planet that doesn't wear make-up---male or
female! Even the animals wear some! <G>

I wouldn't worry about it. If he's comfortable, he'll BE comfortable. Some
folks may make him question whether he wants to keep doing it. He may back
off voluntarily or he may keep it up in spite of them!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
